pullRequest.title: [Feature] automatic text/feedback consistency ui
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features (with a high test coverage)
 Server: I added @PreAuthorize and check the course groups for all new REST Calls (security)
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features (with a high test coverage)
 Client: I added authorities to all new routes and check the course groups for displaying navigation elements (links, buttons)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context


It displays feedback conflicts in text assessments to the tutors/instructors. It allows them to see/compare two feedback side by side and update the conflicting one.
Description


Added one boolean field to FeedbackConflict entity (db change)
Added one new REST call for getting submissions with conflicting feedback
Added one new REST call for manually solving feedback conflict
Added one new page for displaying multiple submissions

Steps for Testing



You can use the course and text exercise that I created in test server 3 and skip to the step 5.


If you want to test this locally, you have to run the Athene as well.



Log in to Artemis
Create a text exercise with automatic assessments are enabled.
Create 5-6 submissions.
Wait for the submission due date so clusters can be generated.
Start assessing. (better to use different tutors)
Look for the feedback with automatic suggestions and assess it completely differently. (Submit not save)
If you wait for few seconds and refresh the page you will see the conflict badge. (Screenshot 1)
Click on the badge and navigate to conflict page. (GIF 1)
You can see the yellow conflicting feedback pairs and switch to other submissions if there are any.
You can deal with the conflict in two ways
a) Change the feedback on the left and override the submission. (GIF 2)
- With this approach, conflict might be solved by Athene or more conflicts can be generated.
- Clicking this will take you to the previous page, you have to wait and refresh the page to see if the conflict is resolved. (Athene calculation works asynchronously)
b) You can select one of the conflicting feedback on the right and mark it as no conflict(button name changed into -> discard). (GIF 3)
- which means according to the tutor that is not a conflict.
- You can select only one conflicting feedback on the right. (In theory, there can be more than conflicts)
- This will also take you to the previous page, you should see number of conflicts are reduced for that feedback.

Screenshots






Test Coverage



Server
TextAssessmentResource - 93%
AutomaticTextAssessmentConflictService - 91%
TextAssessmentService - 90%


Client Tests

nodes.bodyText: Codacy found an issue: The JUnit 5 test method name 'retrieveConflictingTextSubmissions_otherTutorForbidden' doesn't match '[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*'
What happens if credits is actually undefined? Can this happen?
See above
What is this input? Is this the same as conflictType === undefined?
Same question as in textblock-feedback-editor.component.ts

Should this negate conflictMode?
    [class.neutral-feedback]="(textBlockRef.feedback?.credits === 0 && !conflictMode) || (conflictMode && !isConflictingFeedback)"

Can this be simplified like so?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                [class.neutral-feedback]="(textBlockRef.feedback?.credits === 0 && conflictMode) || (conflictMode && !isConflictingFeedback)"
          
          
            
                [class.neutral-feedback]=" !conflictMode ? textBlockRef.feedback?.credits === 0 : !isConflictingFeedback"
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -7,9 +7,10 @@
     (click)="select()"
     [class.text-with-feedback]="!!textBlockRef.feedback"
     [class.active]="selected"
-    [class.positive-feedback]="textBlockRef.feedback?.credits! > 0"
-    [class.negative-feedback]="textBlockRef.feedback?.credits! < 0"
-    [class.neutral-feedback]="textBlockRef.feedback?.credits === 0"
+    [class.positive-feedback]="textBlockRef.feedback?.credits! > 0 && !conflictMode"
+    [class.negative-feedback]="textBlockRef.feedback?.credits! < 0 && !conflictMode"
+    [class.neutral-feedback]="(textBlockRef.feedback?.credits === 0 && conflictMode) || (conflictMode && !isConflictingFeedback)"

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                INCONSISTENT_COMMENT = 'INCONSISTENT COMMENT',
          
          
            
                INCONSISTENT_SCORE = 'INCONSISTENT SCORE',
          
          
            
                INCONSISTENT_FEEDBACK = 'INCONSISTENT FEEDBACK',
          
          
            
                INCONSISTENT_COMMENT = 'INCONSISTENT_COMMENT',
          
          
            
                INCONSISTENT_SCORE = 'INCONSISTENT_SCORE',
          
          
            
                INCONSISTENT_FEEDBACK = 'INCONSISTENT_FEEDBACK',
This gets called constantly from change detection. It is probably better to compute this once and store it in a map for future reference.
Same

How many submissions are we talking about here? As this is a DB query in a loop, this could be a performance bottleneck.
It would be preferred to fetch all blocks in one query and only do the mapping using loops.
This can be one DB query.
This is not needed. I think this can be replaced everywhere by feedbackConflicts  === undefined?
This is called a lot due to change detection.

         [textBlockRef]="ref"
         [selected]="selectedRef === ref"
         [readOnly]="readOnly"
-        (didSelect)="selectedRef = $event"
+        [isConflictingFeedback]="getIsConflictingFeedback(ref)"
+        [conflictType]="getConflictType(ref)"

commit.message: fix a failing client test & forgotten optional parameter (?)
liquibase change log for new table text_assessment_conflict
TextAssessmentConflict entity class and update in Feedback entity class
DTO classes used in communication with athene service
TextAssessmentConflictService.java service to communicate with Athene service
AutomaticTextAssessmentConflictService to make async calls to athene service
call AutomaticTextAssessmentConflictService when a text assessment is submitted and automatic assessment is enabled
feedback consistency url is added to application-artemis.yml
Minor fix (get text blocks from TextBlockRepository to get cluster information)
query to retrieve all conflicting feedback for the given list of feedback
get all the conflicting submissions for the given result and its corresponding tests
get conflicts while getting the assessment
two new rest calls; getting conflicting text submissions and solving a conflict
UI texts about text assessment conflicts
updates and new method for checking if conflicts are solved
added new tests for new methods in AutomaticTextAssessmentConflictService
new test cases for deletion of entities
new column added to text_assessment_conflict table
consider the case when there is no conflicts
check access for rest calls and javadoc
updates in client after previous PR refactor(2)
update client changes after PR merge #2135
add new field to entity class
bugfix: alerts are not displayed & problematic moment object after submit/save

nodes.bodyText: I though this is already achieved by the variable conflict above? why do we need another boolean flag?
